name: Fantasy Island Beach Resort

reviews.text: Just returned from a week at a really cool tropical destination! I was seeking a last minute dive my brains out/ value driven solo trip. I did a lot of research and made a great decision. here's the data:
reviews.title: The straight skinny....

reviews.text: For $960(Single/Total out the door) Igot a great value and really good dive experience. many places wanted 2x the price for basically the same dive sites and similiar food /service.The reviews here were spot on. Food: adequate, plentiful, way overcooked all the time. The Chef ruined perfectly good cuts of beef, pork, fish by preping and cooking EVERYTHING hours in advance. All the fruits were great and breakfast was the best quality...Staff very attentive/ Buy you own booze at the Gas station down the road and mix em' up in your room. My room requests were not honored and I was given the worst room out of 180! After persistance and a bit of nagging Alejandro I was moved the second day to a PRIMO room. Robert the Dive Hefe was a challenge to work with as his Compressor was not working as it should( for about a year now and a new one is "on the way" from Turkey...) The Dive master had 18pp per boat so you better not have a problem or require too much assistance. I was paired with a large group who were quite uptight and difficult so the fun aspect was missing. Should have demanded to switch boats immediately! Experienced divers could fend for themselves/ rookies suffered. Alot of spearfishing takes place as it's not a protected preserve so corals, micro stuff were wonderful but nothing bigger than 7" could be found. Period. Harp on your Master to take you to the outer dive sights/Do your research and request specific dives. The beaches were clean, raked each day and the overall experience was a "you get what you pay for" trip.
reviews.title: An excellent bargain priced vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at Fantasy Island June 9-16. Even with some of the bad reviews, we hoped for the best. I have to say, it was above our expectations. We did have a problem when we arrived at the airport. There was no Fantasy Island vehicle there to pick us up. There was one other couple on our flight. We waited outside the airport for 1-½ hours before my husband and the other guy threatened to have a taxi take us. The guy at the airport was on the phone yelling at the resort (in English, a show, we think, for out benefit) telling them to get us a ride. The “guys” didn’t buy it and said we would just split a taxi ride. He got us a van taxi that was at the airport to take us to the resort. What we think was happening was they were trying to “hold” us at the airport until the next flight into Roatan came in around 12:30. We didn’t think that was cool. When we arrived at the resort, they tried to give us a room in the D’s (the dive rooms) After reading many reviews, I had requested a room in the 100’s (the newer building) with a king size bed and an extra bed for our son. They said they never got the information from the Fantasy Island Resort booking office. (The 1 800 number on the website) I was disappointed to hear that, but they said they would get us a room as we had requested so we went to eat lunch. Our room was huge!! Very nice, very clean, very nice bathroom. The bathroom was all marble. We did have a problem a couple times with our toilet. Each time we told the front desk, they had someone go take a look and fix it. The shower was fine. We ALWAYS had good water pressure, no matter what time of day. Our cleaning lady was wonderful. Didn’t speak English, but we figured out how to say what we needed to. I had taken a bag of starbursts with us for the plane and had some left. I told her to take some whenever she wanted. (Note to travelers: DO NOT leave your candy/snacks out or you will get ants. We ended up putting our snacks in the fridge. We had a mini fridge in the room with purified water in a pitcher. I packed us woolite and a clothesline and pins and managed to hang that up by the closet. I would wash our swimsuits out nightly, hang them up and they’d be dry by the morning. We really lucked out and had 2 other families there that had kids the same age as our son!! It was great. I think they lived in the ocean diving/snorkeling and the swimming pool after that! They loved the bar staff. Even though we weren’t on an all-inclusive plan, they would make the kids nada colodas and let them sit at the pool bar. The snorkeling was awesome. I would be able to tag along on some of the dives and snorkel while my 2 guys were diving. My husband and son LOVED the diving. They said the walls were amazing. We did the snorkel with the dolphins at Anthony’s Key while we were there. That was an experience of a lifetime. There were about 10 snorkelers and 4 dolphins in the lagoon. The trainer started us our with the dolphin encounter with the entire group, then some of us went snorkeling. They kept biting our fins. It was cool and well worth the money. On our last day there, we decided to rent a car and tour the island. The gift shop on the resort didn’t have any shirts I wanted, so my husband said we could go find one!! We rented a small Kia for the whole day and it cost us $35 total. Well worth the money also!! We drove all around the island into the West End. There was a lot of shopping options there and I did find a shirt! (The same shop is at the Roatan airport when you’re leaving, after customs and in the waiting room) The one thing we were surprised about was the West End was trashy. It smelled like road kill and there was trash all along the beach, and waterfront. Which is kind of disturbing since it is a Marine Park. There were a lot of options for eating, although we did not eat there. We had hoped to stop at Rick’s American Café on the way back to the resort, but he was closed until 5pm. We decided to drive past our resort in the evening on our way back from getting gas and found “The View” wow what an awesome place. We did say that if we do go back to Fantasy Island, we would go out to eat a couple nights while we’re there since the food is kind of bland and not a whole lot of variety. The ice cream was great. We had hoped for a crab night after reading several reviews, but it didn’t happen. We also never got “The best coconut ice cream”. We were bummed about that too!! We did have experience with the sand flies, sand fleas or no see-ums. I packed deep woods off, cutter wipes, and we also bought cactus juice on the resort. Luckily we packed Cortizone cream. We used that nightly when we saw any bites pop up. I don’t know how we would have coped if we didn’t have it. We really didn’t start itching until the day after we got back…some show up a day later. After staying at a Beaches in Jamaica and an Iberostar in Mexico, we’d have to say that the buffets are on par with what is offered there and although the other resorts do seem to have a bigger selection. When you look at the fact that 3 of us were able to stay for seven nights on a full dive package, that would have been one of us at a Beaches, the food and accommodations were more than acceptable.
reviews.title: The price is right!

likes.disliked: — Bathroom & not being able to open the windows to hear the Ocean

reviews.title: Decent place, but not sure I'd go back
reviews.text: We just got back from Fantasy Island Beach Resort. The diving is awsome. Our dive master, Daren and boat captain Moses were nothing short of fantastic. We had 2 large rooms. The first room was totally remodeled and very nice, but it had no view. The second room was, as my daughter put it, substandard. It had a new floor that was unfinished, new furniture and a 40-50 year old bathroom, no screens on the windows and we got a few bugs and lizards because the windows and doors are in need of weather striping. Thank God I packed a can of raid! The second room did have a very nice view. Both rooms had working air conditioners and mini fridges. The daily maid service was very good and we had plenty of clean towels. The food was adquate. Very bland, but lots of it, lacking in varity, really good ice cream. Drinks are very reasonable and down right cheap during happy hour. The activity desk was very helpful and friendly. The 2 evening shows we saw were very good. We were caught off guard when they passed the hat after the show. Next time we went we made sure to have some small bills for the performers. A couple of things I was disapointed about was that the outside cafe was closed, there was no beach service and all activities off site had an additional fee for transportation that is not shown on the web site or in any of their other pamplets and the transpotation fees are to be paid in cash. No ATM on site and the cab fares are pretty high. I did try and get extra cash (for tiping and transportation fees) a couple of times at the bank, but the power was out. The hotel would give you cash on a credit card, with a 12% Fee. Forget Gio's resturant and head for The View. All in all we enjoyed our stay. We took advantage of the June special so the price was right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at Fantasy Island....while the diving is great - huge walls just minutes from shore - the resort was lacking in other areas. Staff was friendly, but hesitant to help at times. Many times they seemed pretty overwhelmed. Resort was well-maintained, but many rooms seemed to have problems. Mine had no bedside light/lamp, and the water pressure was sporadic. Remember to bring an alarm clock as there are no bedside clocks here. Food was O.K., but pretty bland. Bugs are voracious - bug spray/itch cream is essential.
reviews.title: I would do it again
Roatan Rocked - a "dive" report and then some...
reviews.text: Fantasy Island - we got there on Feb 3rd, and as I had guessed, just sort of hung around that day and had some drinks (some sort of rum punch welcome drinks - Charlie called them "Panty Removers" - but then, isn't that a generic term for alcoholic drinks?) LOL

reviews.title: We'll be back!
reviews.text: Gary & I (and Dylon and Brook) were put into the Beach House. What an awesome room. Sucked to have the kids stuck with us, but they were always out and about anyways, so it wasn't so bad. The Beach House apparantly belongs to the owner of Fantasy Island, and he was kicked out to accommodate us! (It was a FULL resort that week!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunday & Monday we had to do our 4 OW dives (continuation of class - must be done before getting certified as a scuba diver).
reviews.title: A solid 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Sunday, class started at 9:00 am. When we went out to the Gazebo for our first dive, I panicked! Everybody else (7 people) jumped in and went down right away. I jumped in, got water in my mask, felt my eyes burning, realized I was not in a nice, safe, confined pool... and just panicked. Got water in my mouth cause I wasn't holding my regulator correctly, because I was in the middle of a... panic!
reviews.title: beautiful beach, great diving, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The instructor came back up, and came over to ask if I was ok and was I coming down? NO! She saw the panic (I assume), and asked if I'd prefer to try again this afternoon. She had another class at 2:00 with only 3 people in it. YES! And I got the heck out of the water just as fast as I could! I know I know... wuss some of you are thinking. Oh well, just couldn't do it. So, waited for Gary to finish his 2 dives, and took pictures.
reviews.title: Awesome snorkeling vicious sand flies

likes.disliked: — Service somewhat slow at times not enough staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this resort the first week in May; arriving on a Saturday and departing the following Saturday. Let me first say that I was a little hesitant about staying here. My wife and I stayed here 3 years ago, and while the diving was great, the resort (room, staff, food, etc.) was not. However, as a scuba diver, the first consideration is the diving, so back we went. Plus, they had a special ($607 per person) that included 3 single tank boat dives a day, one night dive from the boat, unlimited 24 hour shore diving, all your food and room. Couldn’t resist, so off we went…knowing what to expect. Will, things have changed for the better.
reviews.title: The diving is great...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, landing in Roatan and getting through customs is still a nightmare (this is our 4th trip into Roatan). It took us about two hours to clear customs (no A/C in the arrival area), get our luggage and depart on the bus. The Honduran customs/government really needs to get their act together. First impressions mean a lot, and the first impression you get when arriving in Roatan is wanting to turn around and go back to the states. Considering that tourism is the number 1 money maker in Roatan, you would think they could do a better job processing you into the country. With that said, your luggage is taken care of by a Fantasy island/airport guy. We just pulled it off the conveyor and he put it with all the other luggage going to fantasy island. Yes, tip the guy. The bus was waiting with the A/C on. After everyone made it through customs (again what a nightmare), off we went to the resort.
reviews.title: Far from Perfect But a Good Deal Nonetheless

reviews.text: Check-in was fast, painless, and the staff was very friendly. They had all the cards filled out with keys waiting. All you did was tell them your name, sign, and off you went to your room. We stayed in the new section on the 2nd floor. Nice bed and balcony, and very nice bathroom. They have a small refrigerator and cable TV that worked just fine. Our luggage arrived about 20 min later and there were lot’s of resort folks there to take your luggage to your room. The last time we were here, the rooms weren’t ready, the staff was rude, and there was no one to help with your bags. Again, things have improved. I did hear some folks wanted to change their rooms because they weren’t happy with them, and if you stay in the older section, you might not like what you get. Please remember that this is a dive resort in a Central American Country on an isolated island…don’t expect a room like you get at the Radisson.
reviews.title: Changes in the Wind

reviews.text: All three meals at the resort were good. Folks this is a buffet, so don’t expect the Ritz. Some things are better than others, and remember that they cater to Americans, Europeans, and Latin American folks, so there will be some things you won’t like. Overall it was good, and the wait staff was very fast and friendly. They also have 24/7 coffee set up (near the entrance to the restaurant on the 2nd floor), so folks like me who get up and sunrise will have coffee waiting form them.
reviews.title: stay anywhere but here!

reviews.text: The bar downstairs is part of the overall lobby setup that includes two computers with free internet access and a Wi-Fi setup if you bring a laptop. All items bought at the bar or gift shop can be charged back to your room. My biggest complaint in the lobby area was all the smoke. Between all the Europeans (I think they all smoke) and all the folks who felt it necessary to smoke a Cuban cigar while they were there, you couldn’t breath. Look, I quit smoking 2 years ago (after 35 years) and it was so bad (the smoke), I couldn’t stay. Ventilation was nonexistent and there are no laws in Honduras about smoking inside public areas.
reviews.title: Awesome trip!

likes.disliked: — King size sheets never fit (very minor problem)

reviews.text: So I literally got back home yesterday. I'll point out the positives and the negatives, but overall for us this was a $2700 cdn all inclusive (flights, hotels, drinks, diving) vacation which I don't think you could beat if you wanted blue waters, white sandy beaches, great diving, etc. Would I go back? Probably not as I'd like to experience diving at other spots around Roatan.
reviews.title: An Interesting Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I liked...
reviews.title: We will come back

reviews.text: The whole vacation was totally cheap and the dive crew was awesome. The dive shop manager, Robert, was awesome. He was all about safety and so were the divemasters. Suprisingly, the colors of the sponges, corals, etc were the brightest I've seen diving. They were totally flexible as to when to dive, etc. Top score for the dive teams.
reviews.title: Loved Fantasy Island and Roatan!

likes.liked: — We loved the intimate/cottage feel to this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also really liked the animals. The monkeys are wild, but resident to the resort. They will feed from your hand and jump on your shoulder if you invite them to. They weren't "in your face" unless you chose to eat outside and stepped away from your dinner plate... in which case they still weren't "in your face" but you'd likely end up less one dinner role or your steak. There were also alot of ducks, iguanas, gecko like lizards, agouti's (guinea pigs on stilts), etc.
reviews.title: Had a great week

reviews.text: The home made icecream. YumYum. You gotta try the coconut icecream!!!!!
reviews.title: A second chance

description: Fantasy Island Beach Resort is a private 21 acres island located on the south coast of Roatán, 8 miles from Roatan international airport and 30 miles from the northern coast of Honduras main land. (840 miles from Miami and 990 from New Orleans). The hotel has 115 rooms spread along the beach shore in buildings of 2 levels with the architecture characteristic of the island, three private beaches of white sand and calm surf, restaurants and bars, internet service throughout the hotel, PADI scuba diving center, marina, underwater photography, dive shop and souvenirs. Fantasy Island offers a tradition of hospitality combined with the tropical surroundings, amenities and adventures that you are looking for your next vacation to the Caribbean. Get in touch with nature and enjoy the colorful scenery that Fantasy Island Beach Resort has to offer.
